title: Introduction
author: Justin Ryan Uy
content: Mathematics is a language that man invented in order to explain the patterns and wonders of the world. Since the dawn of civilization, humans have sought to understand and interpret the complexities of the world around them. From the rhythms of the seasons to the intricate designs of a snowflake, patterns and structures are woven into the fabric of existence. To make sense of seeming chaos, humanity devised a universal tool: mathematics. Far more than numbers and equations, mathematics serves as a languageâ€”a symbolic framework created to describe, predict, and uncover the mysteries of nature. These aricles will explore how the mathematical system enables us to emulate the beauty and wonder of nature in our artistry to better convey the expression of human emotion. Math helps us understand the world, and in this understanding of the natural order, we consequently learn to understand ourselves.
